paragraph: Ig Henneman (born 21 December 1945) is a Dutch composer and bandleader. She was born in Haarlem, Netherlands, and took music lessons as a child. She studied viola and violin in Amsterdam and Tilburg, and composition with Robert Heppener. After completing her studies, Henneman worked as a violist in orchestras, and then co-founded the rock band FC Gerania where she began to compose. In 1985 she founded the Ig Henneman Quintet. She also improvises on viola with Henneman Sextet, Duo Baars-Henneman with Ab Baars and the Queen Mab Trio.
Henneman has composed for orchestras, ensembles and soloists, plus pieces for film and theater.
Baby Ryazanskye film soundtrack (1927) silent movie by Olga Preobrasjenskaja
Bow Valley Whistle for flute and samples
Kindred Spirits improvisational projectHer work has been recorded and issued on CD, including:
Ig Henneman Jaimie Branch Anne La Berge, Dropping Stuff and other Folk Songs (RPR 1094, Wig 29) 2019
Ig Henneman Sextet, Cut a Caper (Wig 19) 2010
